lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Parses String and returns type of info that is required for input
* Gets desription of a todo task
* @return an array with description, start time and end time
* Class that encapsulates 2 methods to load file or write to file
public static ArrayList<Task> loadFile() throws IOException {
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Class that encapsulates UI interaction with user
System.out.println("Hello! I'm duke.Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints wrong date format error message
System.out.println("Please write your deadline in this format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm ");
public Deadline(String description, String deadline, boolean isDone) {
return "[D]" + super.toString() + " (by:" + this.deadline.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy h:mm a")) + ")";
* A subclass of a task: Event
public Event(String description, String begin, String end, Boolean isDone) {
* Represents a task that has a description, an boolean whether it is done or not done
* Mark a task as not done
* Parse the task to be stored in hard disk

* Nicely prints out all the task

* Prints out default message after adding a dask
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this duke.task:\n" + list.get(list.size() - 1));
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* @param i index of task in arraylist
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* @param i index of task in arraylist
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this duke.task as done:\n" + list.get(i));
